newsitem.title: POLAND: PEKPOL TO REVISE DOWN 1997 NET FORECAST.
newsitem.headline: PEKPOL TO REVISE DOWN 1997 NET FORECAST.

text.p: Polish food producer Pekpol SA will revise down its 1997 2.5-million-zloty net profit prognosis after recording losses in May and June, the firm's deputy economics director told Parkiet in its Tuesday edition.
Earlier this year the firm said it would lift its net profit by 39.1 percent this year to 2.5 million zlotys and sales by 25.1 percent to 247.7 million zlotys.
"The correction won't be as deep as the May and June data might suggest," Krystyna Szpyrkowska was quoted as saying, adding that a new prognosis should be published by end-July.

The firm lost 0.2 million zlotys in May and 0.1 million in June and earned 0.02 million zlotys in the first half against 1.9 million in first-half 1996. January-June sales are down slightly to 92.5 million zlotys from 95.3 million.

Szpyrkowska said reasons for the May and June losses included unfavourable currency fluctuations and lower than expected sales, in June partly due to changes in Pekpol's transport fleet. -- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
